meanings.definition: To squint or look with one eye partly closed.
meanings.sent1: She squinniered in the bright sunlight to see the road better.
meanings.sent2: He always squinniers when he forgets his glasses.
meanings.sent3: The detective squinniered at the suspect, trying to read his expression.
meanings.sent4: The old man squinniered at the tiny print, struggling to make out the words.
meanings.sent5: The child squinniered at the tiny bug crawling on the leaf.

meanings.sent1: The squinnier walked carefully to avoid tripping.
meanings.sent2: She asked the squinnier to try on different glasses at the store.
meanings.sent3: The squinnier won the staring contest by squinting the longest.
meanings.sent4: The squinnier's eyes sparkled behind the squint.
meanings.sent5: The squinnier's face scrunched up as he tried to see the distant sign.

meanings.sent1: Her squinnier was a sign that she was deep in thought.
meanings.sent2: The squinnier of the child indicated he was trying to see the board clearly.
meanings.sent3: The sudden squinnier made everyone laugh during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: The squinnier of the cat made it look mischievous.
meanings.sent5: The squinnier of the old man made him look wise and mysterious.
